snippet: The air marshal was dismissed for contacting an MSNBC reporter after overnight stays were halted in a cost-cutting move, which he contended would leave some flights unprotected.
abstract: Supreme Court, in 7-2 decision, rules dismissal of air marshal Robert J MacLean was unlawful, saying he was covered by law protecting whistle-blowers; MacLean told MSNBC reporter air marshals would not be on some important flights in order to save money at Transportation Security Administration.
lead_paragraph: The air marshal was dismissed for contacting an MSNBC reporter after overnight stays were halted in a cost-cutting move, which he contended would leave some flights unprotected.

headline.main: Justices Rule Dismissal of Air Marshal Unlawful
headline.print_headline: Justices Rule Dismissal of Air Marshal Unlawful
